forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Temporary generators are commissioned by end-April and provide enough capacity to stabilize supply; the government allows the emergency proclamation to lapse on April 29 without renewing it, so there is no state of emergency in effect on April 30 (local time).
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Commissioning of temporary generators slips, or supply/fuel/logistics issues keep outages severe; the Cabinet extends the existing proclamation beyond April 29 or issues a new one, leaving a state of emergency in force on April 30.
forecast.rationale: The government’s March 31 proclamation reportedly set the emergency through April 29, 2025. That sets the status quo to “No” for April 30 unless an extension is announced. The research assistant notes that temporary generators were expected to be online by the end of April, aligning with the emergency’s scheduled end, while the permanent fix is only due around August. If the temporary capacity comes online on schedule, authorities have a clear off-ramp to let the emergency lapse. Political incentives generally favor ending an emergency once a credible interim solution exists. However, short slippages are common in commissioning power assets, and Samoa’s grid likely remains tight even with temporary units. The government may prefer to keep emergency powers briefly (e.g., for fuel procurement, load-shedding management, or price controls) if reliability is uncertain, which creates a real risk of a short extension that covers April 30. Why not higher: The declared end date is April 29, and local reporting anticipates temporary generators by end-April, which would reduce the need for continued emergency powers. Why not lower: The crisis is ongoing, the permanent solution is months away, and delays in commissioning or fuel/logistics could make a short extension prudent; governments often extend emergencies in such contexts. What would move me up: Credible reports of delays in generator arrival/commissioning, continued widespread blackouts late in April, or official hints that Cabinet will extend the proclamation. What would move me down: Official confirmation that temporary generators are online and stable before April 29, or a clear government statement that the emergency will end without renewal.
